TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit SamlSecurityTokenAuthenticator extends System.IdentityModel.Selectors.SecurityTokenAuthenticator

remarks.format: ## Remarks Use the SamlSecurityTokenAuthenticator class to authenticate <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSecurityToken> security tokens.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(class System.Collections.Generic.IList`1<class System.IdentityModel.Selectors.SecurityTokenAuthenticator> supportingAuthenticators) cil managed

Docs.param: An <xref:System.Collections.Generic.IList%601> of that contains the authenticators to authenticate the issuer's security tokens.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class using the specified set of authenticators.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(class System.Collections.Generic.IList`1<class System.IdentityModel.Selectors.SecurityTokenAuthenticator> supportingAuthenticators, valuetype System.TimeSpan maxClockSkew) cil managed

Docs.param: An <xref:System.Collections.Generic.IList%601> of that contains the authenticators to authenticate the issuer's security tokens.
A <xref:System.TimeSpan> that represents the maximum allowable difference between the sender's and receiver's clocks.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class using the specified set of authenticators and the maximum allowable difference between the sender's and receiver's clocks.
Gets the set of target URIs for which the security token can be targeted for to be considered valid by this instance.
Docs.value: An <xref:System.Collections.Generic.IList%601> of type <xref:System.String> that contains the target URIs for which the security token can be targeted for to be considered valid by this security token authenticator.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Use the AllowedAudienceUris property in a federated application that utilizes a security token service (STS) that issues <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSecurityToken> security tokens. When the STS issues the security token, it can specify the URI of the Web services for which the security token is intended by adding a <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAudienceRestrictionCondition> to the security token. That allows the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Selectors.SamlSecurityTokenAuthenticator> for the recipient Web service to verify that the issued security token is intended for this Web service by specifying that this check should happen by doing the following:
- Set the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Selectors.SamlSecurityTokenAuthenticator.AudienceUriMode%2A> property to <xref:System.IdentityModel.Selectors.AudienceUriMode> or <xref:System.IdentityModel.Selectors.AudienceUriMode>.
- Specify the set of valid URIs, by adding the URIs to the AllowedAudienceUris collection.
- Optionally, override the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Selectors.SamlSecurityTokenAuthenticator.ValidateAudienceRestriction%2A> method to specify the validation algorithm to use for the allowed URI.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets an that specifies whether the security token's should be validated.
Docs.value: An that specifies whether the security token's should be validated.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Use the AudienceUriMode property in a federated application that utilizes a security token service (STS) that issues <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSecurityToken> security tokens. When the STS issues the security token, it can specify the URI of the Web services for which the security token is intended by adding a <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAudienceRestrictionCondition> to the security token. That allows the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Selectors.SamlSecurityTokenAuthenticator> for the recipient Web service to verify that the issued security token is intended for this Web service by specifying that this check should happen by doing the following:
- Set the AudienceUriMode property to <xref:System.IdentityModel.Selectors.AudienceUriMode> or <xref:System.IdentityModel.Selectors.AudienceUriMode>.
- Specify the set of valid URIs, by adding the URIs to the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Selectors.SamlSecurityTokenAuthenticator.AllowedAudienceUris%2A> collection.
> [!NOTE] > When the AudienceUriMode property is set to <xref:System.IdentityModel.Selectors.AudienceUriMode>, an incoming non-endorsing <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSecurityToken> must contain a <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAudienceRestrictionCondition> and the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAudienceRestrictionCondition.Audiences%2A> collection must contain a URI that matches one of the valid URIs specified in the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Selectors.SamlSecurityTokenAuthenticator.AllowedAudienceUris%2A> collection. A non-endorsing or bearer token is a security token that is included in the message and not used to sign any part of the message.
- Optionally, override the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Selectors.SamlSecurityTokenAuthenticator.ValidateAudienceRestriction%2A> method to specify the validation algorithm to use for the allowed URI.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig virtual instance bool CanValidateTokenCore(class System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SecurityToken token) cil managed

Docs.summary: Gets a value that indicates whether the specified security token can be validated by this security token authenticator.
Docs.returns: when is a security token; otherwise, .

remarks.format: ## Remarks The CanValidateTokenCore method does not authenticate the security token; that is performed by the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Selectors.SamlSecurityTokenAuthenticator.ValidateTokenCore%2A> method.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance class System.Security.Principal.IIdentity ResolveIdentity(class System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SecurityKeyIdentifier keyIdentifier) cil managed

Docs.param: A to get the identity of.

Docs.returns: An <xref:System.Security.Principal.IIdentity> that represents the identity of the specified key identifier.

remarks.format: ## Remarks <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSecurityToken> security tokens are cached using their key identifier.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig newslot virtual instance bool ValidateAudienceRestriction(class System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAudienceRestrictionCondition audienceRestrictionCondition) cil managed

Docs.param: A that specifies the set of target Web services for which the security token is intended.
Docs.summary: Validates that the security token was intended for this Web service.
Docs.returns: if the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAudienceRestrictionCondition.Audiences%2A> property of the parameter is in the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Selectors.SamlSecurityTokenAuthenticator.AllowedAudienceUris%2A> collection; otherwise, .

remarks.format: ## Remarks The ValidateAudienceRestriction method is called by the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Selectors.SamlSecurityTokenAuthenticator.ValidateTokenCore%2A> method when the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Selectors.SamlSecurityTokenAuthenticator.AudienceUriMode%2A> property is set to <xref:System.IdentityModel.Selectors.AudienceUriMode> or <xref:System.IdentityModel.Selectors.AudienceUriMode>.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig virtual instance class System.Collections.ObjectModel.ReadOnlyCollection`1<class System.IdentityModel.Policy.IAuthorizationPolicy> ValidateTokenCore(class System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SecurityToken token) cil managed

Docs.summary: Authenticates the specified security token and returns the set of authorization policies for the security token.
Docs.returns: A <xref:System.Collections.ObjectModel.ReadOnlyCollection%601> of type that contains the set of authorization policies that result from the security token authentication.
